poem:
Madonna's Ascent

In New York's shadows,  
a dancer spun dreams;  
hard pavements softened  
beneath her steps.   
The world watched, breath caught  
as ambition turned blonde,  
redefining the sun.  
In archives, whispers  
of a transformation;  
a map of desire etched  
on fame's brief canvas,  
echoing notes of a  
quiet revolution.
